<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Copyright (c) 1922, Early English Text Society. This text may not be reproduced, except for fair dealing purposes, without the express permission of Chadwyck-Healey and the copyright holder.</description>
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
<description type="note">Square brackets represent sections of text unclear in the original and supplied by the current editor.</description>

here Enteryth þe Apostyl petyr and johan þe euangelyst with hym. petyr seyng O ?e pepyl dyspeyryng be glad A gret cause ?e haue and ?e kan se þe lord of all þing of nowth mad is comyng ?our comfort to be All ?our langorys salvyn xal he ?our helthe is more þan kan wete. jhesus Ffrendys be-holde þe tyme of mercy The whiche is come now with-owt dowth mannys sowle in blys now xal edyfy and þe prynce of þe werd is cast owth. Go to ?on castel þat standyth ?ow Ageyn sum of myn dyscyplis go forth ?e to þere xul ?e ffyndyn bestys tweyn An Asse tyed and here fole Also Vn-losne þat Asse and brynge it to me pleyn Iff any mas Aske why þat ?e do so Sey þat I haue nede to þis best certeyn and he xal not lett ?ow ?our weys for to go þat best brynge ?e to me. 1us Apostolus holy prophete we gon oure way we wyl not ?oure wourd de-lay Also sone as þat we may We xal it brynge to the. here þei ffecch þe Asse with þe ffole and þe burgeys seyth Burgensis Herke ?e men who ?aff ?ow leve Thus þis best ffor to take Away but only ffor pore men to releve this Asse is ordayned as I ?ow say. Philippus Good sere take this At no greff Oure mayster us sent hedyr þis day he hath grett nede with-owt repreff þerfore not lett us I þe pray þis best for to lede. Burgensis Sethyn þat it is so? þat he hath ?ow sent werkyth his wyll and his intent take þe beste as ?e be bent and evyr wel mote ?e spede. jacobus minor This best is brought ryght now here lo holy prophete At þin owyn wylle And with þis cloth Anon Also þis bestys bak we xal sone hylle. Philippus Now mayst þou ryde whedyr þou wylt go Thyn holy purpos to ffulfylle thy best fful redy is dyth þe to bothe meke and tame þe best is stylle And we be redy Also Iff it be plesynge to þi ssyght The to helpe A-non forth ryght Vpon þis best þat þou were dyght þi jurney ffor to do. here cryst rydyth out of þe place And he wyl and Petyr and Johan Abydyn stylle And at þe last whan þei haue don þer prechyng þei mete with jhesu, Petrus O ?e pepyl dyspeyryng be glad A grett cawse ?e haue and ?e kan se þe lord þat all thynge of nought mad is comynge ?our comforte to be All ?our langoris salvyn xal he ?our helthe is more than ?e kan wete He xal cawse þe blynde þat þei xal se þe def to here þe dome for to speke. þei þat be crokyd he xal cause hem to goo In þe wey þat johan baptyst of prophecyed Sweche A leche kam ?ow nevyr non too Wher-fore what he comawndyth loke ?e Applyed þat som of ?ow be blynd it may not be denyid Ffor hym þat is ?our makere with ?our gostly ey ?e xal not knowe of his comaundement in ?ow gret necglygens is Aspyed Where-fore def fro gostly heryng clepe ?ow I howe. And some of ?ow may not go ?e be so crokyd For of good werkyng in ?ow is lytyl habundawns Tweyn fete heuery man xuld haue and it were lokyd Wyche xuld bere þe body gostly most of substawns Ffyrst is to love god Above all other plesawns þe secunde is to love þi neybore as þin owyn persone and yf þese tweyn be kepte in perseveraw?s Into þe celestyal habytacion ?e Arn habyl to gone. Many of ?ow be dome why for ?e wole not redresse Be Mowthe ?our dedys mortal but þer-in don perdure Of þe wych but ?e haue contrycyon and ?ow confesse ?e may not in-heryte hevyn þis I ?ow ensure And of All þese maladyes ?e may haue gostly cure For þe hevynly leche is comyng ?ow for to vicyte And as for payment he wole shewe ?ow no redrure Ffor with þe love of ?owre hertys he wole be Aqwhyte. Apostolus johannes On to my brotherys for-seyd rehersall þat ?e xuld ?eve þe more veray confydens I come with hym as testymonyall Ffor to conferme and fortefye his sentens þis lord xal come with-out resystens On to þe Cety-ward he is now comyng Where-fore dresse ?ow with all dew dylygens To honowre hym as ?our makere and kyng. And to fulfylle þe prophetys prophese Vp-on An Asse he wole hedyr ryde Shewyng ?ow exawmple of humylyte Devoydyng þe Abhomynable synne of pryde Whech hath ny conqweryd all þe werd wyde Grettest cause of All ?our trybulacyon Vse it ho so wole for it is þe best gyde þat ?e may haue to þe place of dampnacyon. Now brothyr in god syth we have intellygens þat oure lord is ny come to þis cete To Attend up-on his precyous presens it syttyth to us as semyth me Wherfore to mete whit hym now go we I wold fore no thyng we where to late to þe cete-ward fast drawyth he me semyth he is ny at þe gate here spekyth þe iiij ceteseynys þe fyrst þus seyng 1us ciues de jherusalem Neyborys gret joye in oure herte we may make þat þis hefly kyng wole vycyte þis cyte. ijus ciues Yf oure eerly kyng swech a jorne xuld take to don hym honour and worchepe besy xuld we be. iijus ciues Meche more þan to þe hevynly kyng bownd Are we Ffor to do þat xuld be to his persone reuerens. iiij ci[ues] late vs þan welcome hym with flowrys and brawnchis of þe tre Ffor he wole take þat to plesawns becawse of redolens. here þe iiij ceteseynys makyn hem redy for to mete with oure lord goyng barfot and barelegged and in here shyrtys savyng þei xal haue here gownys cast A-bouth theme and qwan þei seen oure lorde þei xal sprede þer clothis be-forn hyme and he xal lyth and go þer upone and þei xal falle downe up-on þer knes alle atonys þe fyrst þus seyng ius ciues Now blyssyd he be þat in oure lordys name to us in Any wyse wole resorte And we be-leve veryly þat þou dost þe same For be þi mercy xal spryng mannys comforte. here cryst passyth forth þer metyth with hym a serteyn of chylderyn with flowrys and cast be-forn hyme and They synggyn Gloria laus and be-forn on seyt Thow sone of davyd þou be oure supporte At oure last day whan we xal dye Where-fore we Alle Atonys to þe exorte Cryeng mercy mercy mercye. Jhesu Ffrendys be-holde þe tyme of mercy þe wich is come now with-owtyn dowth Mannys sowle in blysse now xal edyfy And þe prynce of þe werd is cast owth As I haue prechyd in placys A-bowth And shewyd experyence to man and wyf In to þis werd goddys sone hath sowth Ffor veray loue man to revyfe. The trewthe of trewthis xal now be tryede and A perfyth of corde be-twyx god and man Wich trewth xal nevyr be dyvide Confusyon on to þe fynd sathan. ius pauper homo þou sone of davyd on vs haue mercye As we must stedfast be-levyn in þe þi goodnesse lord lete us be nye Whech lyth blynd here and may not se. ijus pauper homo Lord lete þi mercy to us be sewre and restore to us oure bodyly syth We know þou may us wel recure With þe lest poynt of þi gret myth. Jhesu ?owre be-leve hath mad ?ou for to se And delyveryd ?ou fro All mortal peyn blyssyd be All þo þat be-leve on me And se me not with here bodyly eyn. here Cryst blyssyth here eyn and þei may se þe fryst seyng ius pauper homo Gromercy lord of þi gret grace I þat was blynd now may se. ijus pauper homo Here I for-sake al my trespace And stedfastly wyl be-levyn on þe.
